## This room will be closed and archived.
** @/all Please move discussion of this topic to our forum, or to one of the official Free Code Camp chat rooms: http://forum.freecodecamp.com/t/free-code-camp-official-chat-rooms/19390**

-----

hello doha campers!

##Please note that we now recommend campers use their Campsite’s Facebook group for chatting instead of their campsite’s Gitter chatroom. 
We are doing this because few of our Campsite Gitter chatroooms have active synchronous discussions, and about 1/3rd of conversations consist of someone saying “hello” and not getting a response. Most of the discussions are asynchronous, which Facebook posts and group messages are better suited for.
We’ve removed this Gitter room from our Campsite directory. Still, we will keep it open for archival purposes, and you can keep using it if you’d like.
Here’s a short blog post about how our Campsites are evolving and growing: http://blog.freecodecamp.com/2015/09/jump-start-your-local-campsite-with-coffee-and-code.html
hey @seenothatsme ! welcome around :smile:
Hey Doha FCC members :D
@teomara Yeah, it would be good to pair up in completing some of the bonfires.
@pelez21 Nice! Good luck. Hope i can catch up by the time you reach the Bonfires.
@teomara I'm currently on the Basic Javascript waypoint after completing the 3 previous waypoints. Steady and progressive so far.

@all Hi coders. I finished both intro to HTML&CSS + Responsive Web Design on Udacity. I also just completed the HTML and CSS waypoint on FCC. Next is the Responsive Webdesign with bootstrap waypoint. How's everyone's progress going so far?
Hey @teomara yes I am knew to FCC ,I started 2 weeks a go and I am taking udacity  Responsive Web Design Fundamentals and Object-Oriented JavaScript  too
@pelez21 nice! well i'm currently taking udacity's Front-End Development course. I'm trying to have a solid foundation before fully committing to FCC.
i had looked at some courses on codecademy before learning about FCC on a blog. So it was interesting to see quite a bit of the lesson modules use codecademy resources.
@teomara, yes i'm new to FCC as well having started the course material on here just a few weeks back.
I took  a number of online courses about web development and now i'm hocked.
are you guys still on the noob train as myself? i'm new to FCC and javascript in general @Alaa-- @pelez21
Hey @pelez21 and @Alaa-- :smile:
